plugins.name: Heavy Page Organizer
plugins.description:
Heavy Frame Organizer is a Figma plugin that helps you quickly organize components and sections on your canvas. With customizable spacing options, the plugin automatically arranges your main component at the top left, and positions related sub-components vertically below it. Sections are moved to the right of the main component, with spacing between each element based on user-defined settings. This tool helps streamline the organization of complex design files and improves your workflow efficiency.


Important:

The plugin only works while listening to Meshuggah
plugins.tagline: A very heavy Figma plugin for organizing pages.

plugins.name: Round Off
plugins.description:
This plugin helps avoid the Figma export bug where any decimal values in a frame's position values are are rounded up on export, resulting in a subpixel white line on the sides of your exported PNGs.


Apply to all top-level frames or to just to frames selected and remove all decimal values from the x and y positions before export.


Never see that white line again!
plugins.tagline: Avoid PNG export bugs by rounding off all decimals from your top level frames' position values.

plugins.name: Interflow Connect
plugins.description:
Transform your design-to-management workflow with Interflow Connect, the Figma plugin that brings your UI flows directly into the Interflow. Designed for product teams and designers who demand efficiency, Interflow Connect eliminates the tedious process of manual uploads, allowing you to focus on what truly matters‚Äîcreating exceptional user interfaces.


Streamlined Workflow, Unmatched Efficiency


With Interflow Connect, transferring your designs from Figma to Interflow is as simple as a few clicks. Select your desired frames within Figma, assign or create the appropriate flow and section names, and upload your screens directly to the Interflow without ever leaving your design environment. This seamless integration ensures your UI flows are always up-to-date and easily accessible for audits and reviews, making collaboration across teams more efficient than ever.


Secure, Direct Integration


Security and simplicity are at the heart of Interflow Connect. By inputting and authenticating your personal API key‚Äîgenerated from your Interflow settings‚Äîthe plugin securely identifies your account, organization, and product. This robust authentication process guarantees that your design data is transmitted safely and accurately, offering a streamlined connection between your creative process in Figma and your product management workflow in Interflow.


Empower Your Product Design and Management


Interflow Connect is more than just a plugin‚Äîit‚Äôs the bridge between your design interface and your management platform. Whether you‚Äôre refining your product‚Äôs UI, conducting detailed audits, or ensuring that every screen aligns with your design strategy, this plugin is engineered to supercharge your workflow. Enjoy a smoother onboarding process, reduce manual errors, and keep your design projects perfectly synchronized with your product roadmap.


Experience a new level of productivity and collaboration by integrating your design and management tools. With Interflow Connect, you‚Äôre not just uploading screens‚Äîyou‚Äôre empowering your team to build better products, faster.
plugins.tagline: The bridge between your interfaces in figma and your interflow.

- Auto-Detect Grids: Automatically detects rows and columns in your selection.

- Custom Naming: Add prefixes and choose between numeric or alphabetic suffixes.

- Mixed Sizes: Works with elements of different sizes in the same grid.

- Figma & FigJam: Compatible with both Figma and FigJam (limited support).

plugins.name: ÊâìÂç∞Â∑•ÂÖ∑ Figma Print Pro
plugins.description:
Introduction

Figma Print Pro is a specialized plugin that helps you create print-ready documents directly in Figma. Easily set up standard or custom page sizes, add bleed areas and crop marks, export high-quality PDFs in multiple color formats, and ensure professional results with built-in DPI checks.


Function Description

  1. Custom & Preset Dimensions: Choose from popular print sizes (A4, A3, B5) or enter exact dimensions.
  2. Bleed & Crop Marks: Add bleed lines and crop marks to prepare for professional trimming.
  3. Multi-page Documents: Generate multi-page print layouts all within a single Figma file.
  4. Color Management: Export PDFs in RGB, CMYK, or grayscale for precise color control.
  5. Adjustable Image Quality: Downsample images and set compression levels to optimize file size.
  6. DPI Checks: Analyze frames to confirm whether resolution meets professional print standards.


Usage

  1. Set Up a Document: In the plugin panel, pick a preset size (A4, A3, B5) or enter your custom width and height.
  2. Adjust Settings: Define bleed margins, enable crop marks, and specify the page count.
  3. Preview: The plugin generates a quick visual preview of each page.
  4. Export to PDF: Choose a color format (RGB, CMYK, or grayscale), select image quality settings, then export.
  5. Check DPI: Run the DPI check tool to ensure images and frames meet print-quality standards.


Tips

  1. Recommended DPI: For most print jobs, 300 DPI is standard. Ensure your images and frames meet or exceed this resolution.
  2. Color Consistency: When using CMYK, note that colors may differ slightly from on-screen previews.
  3. Bleed Setup: If your printer requires a bleed, confirm the exact measurement specifications with your print provider.
  4. Downsampling: Keep an eye on image clarity if you significantly reduce the DPI to minimize file size.

plugins.name: QuikA11y
plugins.description:
Make accessibility seamless. Reference with confidence.


Good design requires understanding accessibility, and you want your design decisions to feel informed. While many accessibility tools exist, they don't focus on educating teams about key standards and guidelines. That's the gap QuikA11y fills ‚Äî making accessibility education effortless, quick, and easy to find.


QuikA11y is a plugin that focuses on educating accessibility standards. Discover instant access to WCAG 2.2 guidelines and empower your design process with expert knowledge and educational insights.


Features:

  1. Quick search on WCAG 2.2 guidelines
  2. Reference all WCAG 2.2 standards and success criteria
  3. Key links to essential WCAG documents and resources
  4. Share accessibility rationales with your team
  5. Place reference notes directly in your designs
  6. Educate and build accessibility awareness
  7. Light and Dark theme to match your preference
  8. Native Figma look and feel

accepted.name: Alex Vong
accepted.description: Hi, I'm Alex;‚úåÔ∏è I'm a designer and front-end developer passionate about crafting beautiful and delightful user interactions through modern web technology.

plugins.name: Variable Copy Paste & Export
plugins.description:
Simple plugin that copies and pastes variables between files. Copied variables can also be exported into CSV format.


HOW TO USE:

  1. Open the plugin and hit "Copy Variables". The copied collections and modes should then appear in the plugin UI.
  2. Go to the file you want to paste to, open the plugin and hit "Paste".
  3. Double-check that the pasted variables match the original. Sometimes they get pasted out of order.
  4. Copied variables can also be exported by hitting "Export" and then clicking on the "Download CSV" link that appears underneath.


PLEASE NOTE: Aliases that reference external (non-local) variables will not work and will be shown in the console if found. Also, pasted variables may not always end up in their original order- I am not a dev and don't know why this happens (if anyone can help, please reach out!!!)
plugins.tagline: Paste variables between files and export to CSV

plugins.name: Logger
plugins.description:
Logger is a Figma plugin designed to help users log changes made to pages and frames within their Figma projects. The plugin provides an easy-to-use interface with two tabs: "Page log" and "Frame log".


Features

Page Log Tab:

  1. A text area box with the placeholder "Describe the change" where users can enter the change made to the page (mandatory field).
  2. A smaller text box with the placeholder "Change requested by" where users can enter the name of the person who requested the change (optional field).
  3. A "Log change" button that is enabled only when the mandatory fields are filled.

Frame Log Tab:

  1. A drop-down menu with the default value "Select frame" that shows the list of frames on the current page. Users can also select a frame directly on the page, and the frame name will be populated in the drop-down (mandatory field).
  2. A text area box with the placeholder "Describe the change" where users can enter the change made to the frame (mandatory field).
  3. A smaller text box with the placeholder "Change requested by" where users can enter the name of the person who requested the change (optional field).
  4. A "Log change" button that is enabled only when the mandatory fields are filled.


Usage Instructions

Page Log:

  1. Navigate to the "Page log" tab.
  2. Enter the description of the change in the "Describe the change" text area.
  3. (Optional) Enter the name of the person who requested the change in the "Change requested by" text box.
  4. Click the "Log change" button (enabled only when the mandatory fields are filled).

Frame Log:

  1. Navigate to the "Frame log" tab.
  2. Select a frame from the "Select frame" drop-down menu or directly select a frame on the page.
  3. Enter the description of the change in the "Describe the change" text area.
  4. (Optional) Enter the name of the person who requested the change in the "Change requested by" text box.
  5. Click the "Log change" button (enabled only when the mandatory fields are filled).


Logic

Page Log:

  1. When the user clicks the "Log change" button, the plugin checks if there is a page named "Change log" in Figma. If not, it creates one.
  2. The plugin then creates a text field with the name of the page for which the log is created within the "Change log" page and adds the following values: Date and time of the log, User's name requesting the change, Change description
  3. If the page and text already exist, the plugin appends the new values to the existing text.

Frame Log:

  1. When the user clicks the "Log change" button, the plugin checks if there is a text field on the frame with the name "Frame log". If not, it creates the text field within the selected frame (top left corner) and adds the following values:
  2. Date and time of the log
  3. User's name requesting the change
  4. Change description
  5. If the text field already exists, the plugin appends the new values to the existing text within the frame.


Conclusion

Logger is a powerful plugin for tracking changes in Figma projects, making it easier to manage and document modifications to pages and frames. With its intuitive interface and robust logging capabilities, Logger is an essential plugin for any Figma user.
plugins.tagline: A simple native plugin helping designers log their changes both at page as well as frame level.

plugins.name: Chartify
plugins.description:
Chartify is a powerful yet simple plugin that helps you turn spreadsheet data into clean, customizable charts ‚Äî directly in Figma.


Just upload a file or paste a public Google Sheets link, and Chartify will generate a beautiful chart that fits right into your design.


What Chartify can do:

  1. Supports data from:
  2. CSV, TSV, Excel (.xlsx/.xls)
  3. Google Sheets (public links)
  4. HTML tables, XML, Word (.docx), PDF, and more
  5. 6 chart types:
  6. Line
  7. Smooth Line
  8. Column
  9. Bar
  10. Pie
  11. Donut
  12. Smart customization options:
  13. Auto layout support
  14. Figma Variables for styles
  15. Optional axes, grid, and legends
  16. Responsive and consistent with your design system



How to use:

  1. Open the plugin.
  2. Upload a data file or paste a public Google Sheets URL.
  3. (Optional) Enter the sheet name.
  4. Choose the chart type.
  5. Adjust settings: auto layout, variables, axes, and legend.
  6. Click Generate ‚Äî your chart will appear directly on the canvas.


Chartify is built for designers who need to visualize data fast ‚Äî without leaving Figma.

plugins.name: Annotate Flow
plugins.description:
Annotate Flow allows you to quickly and conveniently add numbered markers and text comments to any objects in Figma. Ideal for:

  1. conducting reviews,
  2. creating guides,
  3. visually explaining interface elements.


Functionality:

  1. A numbered marker and outline (if enabled) automatically appear next to the selected object.
  2. Comments are placed separately outside the frame and do not fall inside the interface layers.
  3. Ability to choose the background and text color for annotations.
  4. Ability to choose the font size for comment text.
  5. Ability to lock the frames of the created design (except for the plugin elements themselves) with one click.
  6. ‚ÄúDelete Annotation‚Äù button for easy deletion of one or more comments at the same time, even in the middle of numbering. This way, the numbering shifts and does not break.
  7. Convenient and intuitive interface.


üß© Works with any layers and components. No configuration required ‚Äî just select an object and click ‚ÄúADD ANNOTATION‚Äù.
plugins.tagline: Instantly create numbered markers and comments with color settings to annotate, explain any design.

  1. A numbered marker and outline (if enabled) automatically appear next to the selected object.
  2. Comments are placed separately outside the frame and do not fall inside the interface layers.
  3. Ability to choose the background and text color for annotations.
  4. Ability to choose the font size for comment text.
  5. Ability to lock the frames of the created design (except for the plugin elements themselves) with one click.
  6. ‚ÄúDelete Annotation‚Äù button for easy deletion of one or more comments at the same time, even in the middle of numbering. This way, the numbering shifts and does not break.
  7. Convenient and intuitive interface.


üß© Works with any layers and components. No configuration required ‚Äî just select an object and click ‚ÄúADD ANNOTATION‚Äù.
140596.release_notes:
üóëÔ∏è Multi-Select Deletion
Select multiple comment instances on the canvas and remove them all at once instead of one by one.

üî¢ Automatic Re-Indexing
After deletion, remaining comments are renumbered so their indices run consecutively without gaps.

üé® Synchronized Marker & Outline Updates
Each comment is linked to a marker (numbered shape) and an outline. Deletions remove all related nodes, and surviving markers/outlines are renamed and renumbered automatically.

‚ö° Robust & Responsive
Silently ignores missing markers or outlines, always notifies you which comments were deleted, and cleanly exits without errors.
140596.tagline: Instantly create numbered markers and comments with color settings to annotate, explain any design.

plugins.name: Flow Linker
plugins.description:
In large-scale design projects, prototyping every screen-to-screen interaction isn‚Äôt always practical. With dozens or even hundreds of screens, building interactive flows becomes time-consuming and sometimes infeasible, especially when deadlines are tight or priorities shift.


Yet developers and stakeholders still need clarity. They rely on understanding how different screens connect, what the logical flow of a user journey looks like, and where transitions happen even without full prototypes.


That‚Äôs where Flow Link comes in.


Rather than investing hours in building out detailed prototypes, Flow Link lets you visually map out interactions using clean, orthogonal connectors. These lines don‚Äôt just show flow‚Äîthey‚Äôre configurable, styled, navigable, and reusable. And with frame linking, viewers can even jump directly to connected screens, making your Figma file interactive in structure, even without full prototyping.


Flow Link fills the gap between rapid design iteration and clear developer handoff making complex projects more navigable, understandable, and scalable.
plugins.tagline: Your Figma Flow, Made Effortless.

plugins.name: Tiny Exports
plugins.description:
Optimize your exported assets for web and mobile applications with just a few clicks.


Features

  1. Export layers with Figma‚Äôs export settings
  2. Support for layer naming conventions. Useful for setting exports in component libraries.
  3. Export individual layers or all at once
  4. Export only exportable layers under the current selection
  5. Support for TinyPNG compression (API key required) ‚Äì available for free
  6. WIP: Apply export settings automatically to all image layers
  7. WIP: Apply export settings to all manually selected layers
  8. WIP: Alternative image compression


How to Use

  1. Set Figma‚Äôs export settings or use the naming convention `export-[scale]x-[format]` (e.g., `export-1.5x-png`).
  2. Trigger the plugin in Figma while in design mode.
  3. Get a TinyPNG API key from [tinypng.com/developers](https://tinypng.com/developers) and enter it in the plugin‚Äôs Settings tab.
  4. Enable TinyPNG compression for optimized images.
  5. Use the plugin UI to export individual layers or all at once.


Naming Convention

SVGs or PDFs do not support `scale`. If a naming convention is present, it is preferred over Figma's export settings. It is recommended to use Figma's export settings if you can.

  1. Format: `export-[scale]x-[format]`
  2. `scale`: Any number (e.g., 2, 1.5) ‚Äì 1 by default
  3. `format`: png, jpg, svg, or pdf ‚Äì jpg is set by default


Examples:

  1. `imageName [export-1.5x-png]`
  2. `imageName [export-2x-jpg]`
  3. `imageName [export-jpg]`
  4. `svgName [export-svg]`


Security

  1. The TinyPNG API key is stored only locally
  2. The plugin uses a proxy to communicate with the API


Known Issues
plugins.tagline: Easily export all layers with TinyPNG compression.

plugins.name: Elemental
plugins.description:
Elemental lets you export images and copy color and shadow values in a single click‚Äîno need to set a layer to export, or break a color style to see the hex value. Elemental is built for those quick one-off moments when a developer needs an asset or another app is asking for your primary brand color.


What it does:

  1. Export one or more layers as images in your desired file type and size
  2. Copy the fill color of a layer to clipboard in your desired value type
  3. Copy the stroke color of a layer to clipboard in your desired value type
  4. Copy a layer's shadows in css format


How it works:

  1. Keep your Elemental panel handy
  2. Select a layer
  3. Click your desired export or copy button
plugins.tagline: Snag basic assets in a flash

This plugin allows you to bulk replace and export text layers in Figma using CSV files‚Äîperfect for efficient content updates and translation workflows.

Highly useful for localization, bulk edits, or working with external editors.


[Key Features]

‚ë†Bulk Replace Text

Simply upload a CSV file where column A = target text and column B = replacement text. The plugin will find and replace matching text layers in your Figma file.


‚ë°Export Text

Export text content from selected frames or layers into a CSV file. Ideal for translation or review processes.


[How to Use]

Open the plugin and go to the ‚ÄúReplace‚Äù tab to upload your CSV and execute replacement.

Use the ‚ÄúExport‚Äù tab to download the text from selected layers as a CSV file.

When a frame is selected, all text layers within that frame will be exported together as a CSV file.

plugins.name: SnapCap
plugins.description:
Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your FigJam board or Figma Design file in a single click, making it easier than ever to document user experiences as you browse the web.


Please note that to use SnapCap, you will also need to install the companion Chrome extension at snapcap.app/extension


How to Use SnapCap

Installation

  1. Install the Figma plugin
  2. Install the Chrome browser extension, and pin it


Session Setup

  1. Open the FigJam board or Figma Design file where you wish to send screenshots
  2. Launch the Figma plugin and click "Start new session"
  3. Copy the generated session code
  4. Click on the SnapCap browser extension and enter the copied session code


Taking Screenshots

Once your session has connected, click on the SnapCap browser extension anytime you want to take a screenshot and send it to your Figma file. A check mark will be shown on the extension icon to indicate that the screenshot was captured successfully, and it will show up moments later in the Figma file where the FigCap plugin is running.


Ending Session

When you are done taking screenshots, click the End button. If the SnapCap browser extension does not automatically disconnect, you can right click on the extension icon and select "End session"


Demo video and more at www.snapcap.app/
plugins.tagline: Capture screenshots from any webpage and instantly send them to your Figma files

Fig-Refactor ‚Äì Replace Spacing with Figma Variables in One Click


Fig-Refactor is a Figma plugin designed to bring structure and scalability to your design files by replacing hardcoded gaps and paddings with Figma variables ‚Äî in bulk.


Fig-Refactor intelligently scans your selection or entire file, matches raw spacing values to the closest variable from your local or team library, and replaces them with a single click. It even skips values already using variables, keeping your workflow non-destructive and efficient.
